page.title: 08A Local Dairy Farm.
page.content: The Woolley family run a mixed farm; dairy, sheep and arable,but the dairy part is most important for they have 200 cows. In summer time the cows are kept in the fields where they feed on grass, but in the winter they are kept in sheds and fed on silage,a kind of pickled grass, which is produced on the farm.The cows are also fed cowcake, a mixture of grains and important proteins,while they are being milked. Milking takes place twice a day, starting at 4.30 am. and 1.30 pm.Each milking session takes three people 4 hours to complete, even using modern machinery. The milk is pumped into 3 tanks ready for the milk lorry to collect it and take it to Long Clawson Dairy ,5 miles away,for treatment and bottling.
